texts.value: In addition to polymerase activity, this DNA polymerase exhibits 5'-3' exonuclease activity (By similarity). Unlikely to have 3'-5' exonuclease activity due to absence of a 3'-5' exonuclease domain (Probable)
Used in the PCR method because of its high thermostability. Has a relatively high error rate probably related to the lack of exonuclease proofreading functionality
Belongs to the DNA polymerase type-A family

citation.title: Isolation, characterization, and expression in Escherichia coli of the DNA polymerase gene from Thermus aquaticus.
Overproduction of Thermus aquaticus DNA polymerase and its structural analysis by ion-spray mass spectrometry.

Crystal structures of open and closed forms of binary and ternary complexes of the large fragment of Thermus aquaticus DNA polymerase I: structural basis for nucleotide incorporation.
Crystal structures of the Klenow fragment of Thermus aquaticus DNA polymerase I complexed with deoxyribonucleoside triphosphates.
Structure-based design of Taq DNA polymerases with improved properties of dideoxynucleotide incorporation.
